sen.j: 松下禅尼（まつしたぜんに、生没年未詳）は鎌倉時代中期の女性。
sen.e: "Matsushita zenni" was a woman in the middle of the Kamakura period, whose birth & death year is unknown.

sen.j: 元仁元年（1224年）、六波羅探題となった時氏に従って上洛。
sen.e: In 1224, accompanying her husband Tokiuji who became the chief of "Rokuhara Tandai" (the administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto), she went up to Kyoto.

sen.j: のちに鎌倉に戻り、寛喜2年（1230年）の時氏の死後、出家して実家の甘縄邸に住んだ。
sen.e: Later, she returned to Kamakura, and after Tokiuji's death in 1230, she became a Buddhist nun and began to live in the residence of Amanawa, her parents' home.

sen.j: 『徒然草』184段に、障子の切り貼りを手づからしてみせて時頼に倹約の心を伝えたという逸話がみえ、昭和期の国語教科書などにも取り上げられた。
sen.e: "Tsurezuregusa" (Essays in Idleness) mentions at the paragraph number 184 an anecdote that she herself repaired the paper sliding door and taught the spirit of frugality to Tokiyori, and this anecdote was also picked up by the textbook of Japanese-language in the Showa period.
